Trial_Design.evidence: A priori sample size calculation had determined that to detect a difference of 2 points on the VAS, a sample size of 50 subjects per group at followup would be required, given a study power of 80%.

Participants.evidence: One hundred sixteen patients were included and randomly allocated to receive advanced cryotherapy (n = 58) or use of cold packs (n = 58).

Intervention.evidence: One hundred sixteen patients were included and randomly allocated to receive advanced cryotherapy (n = 58) or use of cold packs (n = 58).

Objective.evidence: The hypotheses of this randomized controlled trial (RCT) were that advanced cryotherapy devices compared with cold packs result in...

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes for the study were to evaluate pain with the VAS and analgesics consumption.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: One hundred sixteen patients were included and randomly allocated to receive advanced cryotherapy (n = 58) or use of cold packs (n = 58).

Number_Randomised.evidence: One hundred sixteen patients were included and randomly allocated to receive advanced cryotherapy (n = 58) or use of cold packs (n = 58).

Number_Analysed.evidence: One hundred (50 in each group) patients had complete data available for analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No statistically significant differences in VAS, need for analgesics, nor in secondary outcomes were observed, except for substantially reduced flexion at 6 weeks in the advanced cryotherapy group (114° versus 120°).
